ygData.subject: Re: Camping, a solution
ygData.msgSnippet: This is actually a very good idea.  Also promotes questing.  The tough point is giving the note to a friend.  I see this as becomming a problem.  Also, the
ygData.messageBody:
This is actually a very good idea. Also promotes questing. The tough point
is giving the note to a friend. I see this as becomming a problem. Also,
the questor leaving the zone once you initiate the quest. There are just
too many poeple in the game for the questor to up and leave. when you have
100 poeple plus in a zone, i would guess at least 5 poeple would be looking
for the questor. Wehn one of them finds him/her, then the quest for that
zone, is gone and moves to another. You could spend a ton of time just
trying to get the note to initiate the quest.

regardless, this would solve many of the problems with camping and farming.

Dyvim Kincaid
Stormriders of Cazic Thule

> -----Original Message-----
> From: Mifsud, Michael [mailto:Michael.Mifsud@...]
> Sent: Tuesday, May 25, 1999 9:30 PM
> To: 'warriors_eq@onelist.com'
> Subject: Re: [warriors_eq] Camping, a solution
>
>
> From: "Mifsud, Michael" <Michael.Mifsud@...>
>
> The absolute best idea I heard was a combination of your idea and a quest.
>
> One NPC randomly gives out the quest for the BBC for example.
> She will give
> the questor a note and details of where to find the SK. Once you kill the
> SK the game checks to see if you have the note, if you do than you get the
> BBC as loot.
>
> The questor wanders randomly all over the world. That way a fair
> number of
> players can do the quest IF they want. If they dont want they
> can give the
> note away to a friend to do it. Once you have initiated the quest in one
> zone, she then moves on to another zone.
>
> Make the items REALLY valuable and unique.
>
> > ----------
> > From: Obergfell, Steven[SMTP:SObergfell@...]
> > Reply To: warriors_eq@onelist.com
> > Sent: Wednesday, May 26, 1999 4:27 AM
> > To: 'warriors_eq@onelist.com'
> > Subject: Re: [warriors_eq] Camping, a solution
> >
> > From: "Obergfell, Steven" <SObergfell@...>
> >
> > Here is an idea that may solve camping. I agree with your
> analysis as to
> > why there is so much camping. Because these items always spawn
> on the same
> > NPC, why not ,make the item spawn random? Make sure it still
> spawns on an
> > NPC of the same lvl, but in a different Zone. The Tommy may spawn in HH
> > one
> > time, then in Oasis the next and so on. That way it will be
> difficult to
> > know when and were something will turn up.
> >
> > -----Original Message-----
> > From: Jason Coan [mailto:COANJ@...]
> > Sent: Tuesday, May 25, 1999 1:19 PM
> > To: warriors_eq@onelist.com
> > Subject: [warriors_eq] Camping
> >
> >
> > From: "Jason Coan" <COANJ@...>
> >
> > Its Verant that created the campers. They have made it so that the good
> > items only spawn once in a great while. These items are worth
> having, and
> > worth spending time to obtain. So when I get strong enought to get any
> > particular item I really really want, I camp the monster that drops it
> > until
> > I get one, and chances are that there will be someone else in my party
> > that
> > needs the item to, so we have to camp until they get one too,
> THEN we move
> > on.
> >
> > I do admit camping is a serious problem in the game. But mainly the
> > problem
> > is that there are so many guilds who FARM items for their lower level
> > guild
> > buddies. By farming I mean camping getting their item,
> camping, camping,
> > camping, getting their item, camping camping camping, (loop), until they
> > have enough to give their entire guild.
> >
> > Fine example was last night in Cazic, a SK and a couple caster
> types were
> > camping for rubicite gloves. It was rather obvious when they
> actually got
> > them because the SKs gloves turned red. The gloves are the
> only item that
> > this particular mob drops. After getting his gloves he
> continued to camp.
> > Now why did he need to camp there after he got his item? THATS
> where the
> > camping problem is.
> >
> > I've purposed this solution to verant on their internal beta
> testing beta
> > board which the general public does not have access to, but nobody from
> > verant even bothered to reply:
> >
> > Simply make it so that the higher level items can only be looted once by
> > any
> > given player, perhaps twice (so they can have one for trading purposes),
> > or
> > 4 times for items that you can use 2 of, ie earrings, rings, bracers, 1h
> > weapons.
> >
> >
> > >>> James Wofford <James.Wofford@...> 5.25.99 12:54:03 PM >>>
> > From: James Wofford <James.Wofford@...>
> >
> > Why camp him? Why not just see if hes there, if he isnt, move
> on to other
> > adventures. Campers are what makes this game untolerable
> sometimes. The
> > only camping I do anylonger is camping in with a group that I pull for.
> > And
> > thats just normal mobs, nothing that you have to wait for a spawn on.
> > Come
> > on poeple, camping ruins alot of what this game is intended to be, an
> > ADVENTURE.
> >
> > Camping for a little while is not as bad as the poeple who simply camp a
> > place to farm the item over and over again. I can actually understand
> > doing
> > it for one person who needs the item. But doing it for money
> and such is
> > completely inappropriate IMO.
> >
> > Dyvim Kincaid
> > Stormriders of Cazic Thule
> >
> > > -----Original Message-----
> > > From: Jason Coan [mailto:COANJ@...]
> > > Sent: Tuesday, May 25, 1999 12:08 PM
> > > To: warriors_eq@onelist.com
> > > Subject: Re: [warriors_eq] Gigantic Zweihander - Also John..
> > >
> > >
> > > From: "Jason Coan" <COANJ@...>
> > >
> > > well, we warriors need to cry like babies because we can't get
> > > our way too.....
> > >
> > > Sorry, thats BS, removing a high lvl item because some newbies
> > > can't complete some meaningless quest....c'mon.....thats
> > > crap....I'm still gonna camp him to death.
> > >
> > > >>> "Kevin Koen" <big_k69@...> 5.25.99 12:02:25 PM >>>
> > > From: "Kevin Koen" <big_k69@...>
> > >
> > > To all the is persueing the Gigantic Zweihander!!!
> > >
> > > I spoke with a gm early this morning about this sword
> > > indeed it was carried by Karg but Karg is part of a quest that is
> > > grealty persued. because of this sword Karg was beeing killed so
> > > often that
> > > people could not complete there quest and after much complaing
> > > the sword is
> > > no longer available within the game until they find another
> > > suitable NPC to
> > > weild it...THis is the official word from a gm...sorry to
> spoil anyones
> > > intentions
> > >
> > >
> > > >From: "Mifsud, Michael" <Michael.Mifsud@...>
> > > >Reply-To: warriors_eq@onelist.com
> > > >To: "'warriors_eq@onelist.com'" <warriors_eq@onelist.com>
> > > >Subject: Re: [warriors_eq] Gigantic Zweihander - Also John..
> > > >Date: Tue, 25 May 1999 11:39:53 +0900
> > > >
> > > >From: "Mifsud, Michael" <Michael.Mifsud@...>
> > > >
> > > >Karg Iceberg, I have heard it is One in 40 spawn. Bring a
> > > ranger or druid
> > > >slave to track him, that place is a maze.
> > > >
> > > > > ----------
> > > > > From: Nick Morgowicz[SMTP:nomorgow@...]
> > > > > Reply To: warriors_eq@onelist.com
> > > > > Sent: Friday, May 21, 1999 8:43 PM
> > > > > To: warriors_eq@onelist.com
> > > > > Subject: [warriors_eq] Gigantic Zweihander - Also John..
> > > > >
> > > > > From: Nick Morgowicz <nomorgow@...>
> > > > >
> > > > > Heya, i just saw this latest addition to gameznet and it
> looked very
> > > > > interesting. With 18dmg, 39 delay, and glowing like a greater
> > > > > lighstone, this two handed sword is calling to be my
> > > replacement for the
> > > > > AGI stealing BBC. Thing is though, the website only said
> it would be
> > > > > found on a roaming barbarian in everfrost. Does anyone know which
> > > > > barbarian has it? My drow warrior is already KOS there, so
> > > it's no big
> > > > > deal if i kill a few barbarians :)
> > > > >
> > > > > To John - I didn't catch you on last eve. Hopefully tonight
> > > after work
> > > > > we can get together and share stories. I was in Guk and
> > > Cazic but I'll
> > > > > go anywhere really :)
> > > > >
> > > > > Nick
> > > > >
